getTypeCodeFromName

public static int getTypeCodeFromName(java.lang.String typeName)
Returns the style model code for the style type name.

Parameters:
typeName - - style type name: AREA, COLOR, LINE, MARKER, TEXT, ADVANCED, TTF
Returns:
int - style model code: StyleModel.STYLE_AREA, StyleModel.STYLE_COLOR, StyleModel.STYLE_LINE, StyleModel.STYLE_MARKER, StyleModel.STYLE_TEXT, StyleModel.STYLE_TTF, StyleModel.STYLE_ADVANCED

getTypeNameFromCode

public static java.lang.String getTypeNameFromCode(int typeCode)
Returns the style type name given the style model code.

Parameters:
typeCode - - style model code: StyleModel.STYLE_AREA, StyleModel.STYLE_COLOR, StyleModel.STYLE_LINE, StyleModel.STYLE_MARKER, StyleModel.STYLE_TEXT, StyleModel.STYLE_TTF, StyleModel.STYLE_ADVANCED
Returns:
String - style type name: AREA, COLOR, LINE, MARKER, TEXT, ADVANCED, TTF

getHexidecimalString

public static java.lang.String getHexidecimalString(java.awt.Color c)
Converts a Color instance to its hexidecimal representation. For instance, Color.red ==> "#FF0000". The alpha channel of the color is ignored.

Parameters:
c - - the color to be converted.
Returns:
String - a string starting with '#'.

getStyleTypeFromXML

public static int getStyleTypeFromXML(java.lang.String xml)
Returns the style model code from the style XML definition.

Parameters:
xml - - style XML definition
Returns:
int - style model code

getColor

public static java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String color)
Returns the color object from a given color name string.

Parameters:
color - - the color value (hexadecimal "#ffff00", "0xff0000", or named "blue") Available names: "black","red","green","blue","yellow", "white","pink","magenta","orange", "gray","lightgray","cyan", "us map yellow" (#ffffa5)
Returns:
Color - the color specified. null if no given type of color is specified

getColorOpacity

public static int getColorOpacity(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String str)
Returns the opacity value for the given color opacity name. returns 255 if no such opacity value is specified. Note: we now support the true CSS opacity value range [0-1]; so if the str contains an opacity value such as 0.5, it will be treated as css opacity, and converted into 128 (Java opacity).

Parameters:
name - - the name of the color style parameter ("fill-opacity" or "stroke-opacity")
str - - the SVG style attribute
Returns:
int - color opacity (0-255)

getStrokeWidth

public static float getStrokeWidth(java.lang.String svgStyle)
Returns the stroke-width value of a SVG style string.

Parameters:
svgStyle - - the SVG style attribute string
Returns:
float - the stroke width as defined; 0.0 if not defined.

getStrokeWidthSize

public static SizeDefinition getStrokeWidthSize(java.lang.String svgStyle)
Returns the stroke-width value with unit of a SVG style string.

Parameters:
svgStyle - - the SVG style attribute string
Returns:
SizeDefinition - the stroke width with unit.

getNamedString

public static java.lang.String getNamedString(java.lang.String style,
                                              java.lang.String name)
Returns a named value out of a SVG style string

Parameters:
style - - the SVG style attribute string
name - - the style attribute name
Returns:
String - attribute value

getColorFromRGB

public static java.awt.Color getColorFromRGB(java.lang.String rgb)
Returns the color given an RGB expression on the form: rgb(red,green,blue) with values ranging from 0-255. For example: rgb(230,55,98)

Parameters:
rgb - - RGB expression
Returns:
Color - java Color object (null if can not parse rgb expression)

Returns the format value of a double number in US Locale. The pattern applied for the decimal format is "0.000".

Parameters:
value -
Returns:

public static java.awt.Color[] createTwoStopGradient(java.awt.Color one,
                                                     java.awt.Color two,

                                                     int alpha)

createMultiStopGradient

public static java.awt.Color[] createMultiStopGradient(java.awt.Color[] colors,
                                                       int numSteps,
                                                       int alpha)
Creates an array of Color objects for use as a gradient, using an array of Color objects. It uses a linear interpolation between each pair of points.

Parameters:
colors - An array of Color objects used for the gradient. The Color at index 0 will be the lowest color.
numSteps - The number of steps in the gradient. 250 is a good number.
